1 Welcome
Welcome to a demo Book that uses quarto-webr to generate interactive code cells using Quarto.

title: 2Â  Example page
text:
On this page, we set two options directly in the Quarto document. The rest of the options are coming from the _quarto.yml project file. These options are considered â€œglobalâ€.
The local options that we enabled are to show the webR status bar and to pre-install the ggplot2 and dplyr packages. We create a hypothetical document that compares and constrasts Base R code with Tidyverse code.

3 Sorting
Consider the need to find the highest or lowest values. In this case, weâ€™re seeking to sort or modify the order of the data.
